item.title: Please Don't Teach C to Beginning Programmers
item.description: The Student I have a niece in her first year at a local university. She’s never done any programming before, and thinking of becoming an actuary. That means she should learn at least a little bit of programming in a tool like R or Python, right? Those seem like good high-level languages in 2019 that are also applicable in that field. The Phone Call A few weeks ago I got a call from her Dad asking for some help with homework on an introductory (100-level) programming course titled “Problem Solving in the Natural Sciences (using C and Matlab)”.
